subject: RE: [junit] junit beginner
msgSnippet: Have you looked at ant http://jakarta.apache.org/ant  ?  Ant is much better than writing batch files.  JUnit support is part of the ant optional package.
messageBody:
Have you looked at ant http://jakarta.apache.org/ant ? Ant is much better than writing batch files. JUnit support is part of the ant optional package.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mark Meyers [mailto:markm@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, November 20, 2002 9:32 AM
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [junit] junit beginner
>
>
> >
> > In my compile.bat
> > c:\j2sdk1.4.0\bin\javac -classpath
> > c:\junit3.8.1\junit.jar MoneyTest.java
> >
> > In my run.bat
> > set CLASSPATH=.;c:\junit3.8.1\junit.jar
> > c:\j2sdk1.4.0\bin\java junit.swingui.TestRunner
> > MoneyTest
> >
> c:\j2sdk1.4.0\bin\java junit.swingui.TestRunner
> junit.samples.money.MoneyTest
>
